bibl.title: Letter from Thomas C. Lazear to Mabel H. Lazear, May 27, 1908

div1.p: Thomas Lazear informs Mabel Lazear that the annuity bill has passed.

div1.head: Letter from Thomas C. Lazear to Mabel H. Lazear, May 27, 1908

opener.dateline:
LAZEAR AND ORR
ATTORNEYS AT LAW
450 FOURTH AVENUE
PITTSBURGH, PA.
THOS. C. LAZEAR CHAS. P. ORR
JESSE T. LAZEAR
Pittsburgh Pa. May 27 1908

div1.p:
The President signed the annuity bill last Saturday
and it is now a law of the United States- I presume
the annuity will date from that time- This assures your monthly
payment of $12500 as long as you live-

What effect this new bill will have upon
the special Act which gave you $17 per month and your children
each $2 per month I do not know- It probably amounts
to a repeal of the latter though as to the children it may
not have that effect- But let that question be determined
by the proper officials at Washington- We should not
raise it nor ask any questions about it- The
LAZEAR AND ORR
ATTORNEYS AT LAW
450 FOURTH AVENUE
PITTSBURGH, PA.
THOS. C. LAZEAR CHAS. P. ORR
JESSE T. LAZEAR
Government has dealt generously with us in granting the annuity and
we ought to be satisfied with this-

I am rejoiced beyond measure that this matter is
finally settled- I have worked hard for it for nearly two
years but never did I work for anything more cheerfully- My
heart was in it- You and your children are now comfortably
provided for and great honor has been done to Jesse's memory-
It fills me with pride to hear his name mentioned-
div1.closer: Yours affectionately Thos. C. Lazear Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear.
